intro: Hedlundia borbasii, commonly known as the Borbás hedgehog cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spiny, cylindrical stems that store water. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers during the summer months, which attract pollinators such as bees and moths. Its adaptations to arid environments include reduced leaves and thick, fleshy stems for water retention. Hedlundia borbasii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
